presentations.name: Automation: The Wonderful Wizard of CTI (Or Is IT?)
presentations.description: This presentation from the SANS CTI Summit explores how automation can be applied to cyber threat intelligence using the Threat Report ATT&CK Mapper (TRAM).

presentations.name: Adaptive Adversary Emulation with MITRE ATT&CK
presentations.description: This presentation from the SANS Purple Team Summit looks at moving beyond traditional, rigid adversary emulation by leveraging MITRE ATT&CK.

presentations.name: Keeping CTI on Track: An Easier Way to Map to MITRE ATT&CK
presentations.description: This presentation from BSidesDC covers an overview of ATT&CK and introduces a new tool for automating mapping to it called the Threat Report ATT&CK Mapper (TRAM).

presentations.name: Turning Intelligence Into Action with MITRE ATT&CK
presentations.description: This presentation from Anomali Detect discusses how you can use ATT&CK for threat intelligence, including a process for mapping intelligence to ATT&CK as well as biases to watch out for as you do this. Slides are also available.

presentations.name: Leveraging MITRE ATT&CK for Detection, Analysis & Defense
presentations.description: This presentation from the RH-ISAC Retail Cyber Intelligence Summit covers all four of the primary ATT&CK use cases, with a focus on detection and analytics, and assessments and engineering.

presentations.name: MITRE ATT&CK: The Play at Home Edition
presentations.description: This presentation from Black Hat walks through the story of a fictional organization in order to explain how different teams can use ATT&CK as a powerful force to improve defenses. Slides are also available.

presentations.name: ATT&CKing Your Adversaries - Operationalizing cyber intelligence in your own environment for better sleep and a safer tomorrow
presentations.description: This presentation from BSidesLV covers how to use ATT&CK to take cyber threat intelligence and operationalize it into behaviors that can drive relevant detections. Slides are also available.

presentations.name: Lessons Learned Applying ATT&CK-Based SOC Assessments
presentations.description: This keynote presentation from the SANS Security Operations Summit discusses a process to gauge a SOC’s detective capabilities as they relate to ATT&CK, including MITRE’s practical experiences and lessons learned.

presentations.name: Finding Dependencies Between Adversary Techniques
presentations.description: This presentation from the Annual FIRST Conference presents different methods of using ATT&CK to find dependencies between adversary techniques to support defense.

presentations.name: Do-It-Yourself ATT&CK Evaluations to Improve Your Security Posture
presentations.description: This presentation from the SANS Enterprise Defense Summit explains how defenders can improve their security posture through the use of adversary emulation by performing their very own ATT&CK Evaluations.

presentations.name: APT ATT&CK - Threat-based Purple Teaming with ATT&CK Continued
presentations.description: This presentation from x33fcon takes a deep-dive into using ATT&CK for purple teaming, including lessons learned from ATT&CK Evaluations. Slides are also available.

presentations.name: Putting MITRE ATT&CK into Action with What You Have, Where You Are
presentations.description: This presentation from Sp4rkcon presents an overview of ATT&CK as well as ideas for how you can put it into action for four use cases. Slides are also available.

presentations.name: To Blue with ATT&CK-Flavored Love
presentations.description: This presentation from the SANS Blue Team Summit provides a red teamer’s perspective to show how ATT&CK is a valuable tool to help red and blue teams work together to improve their defenses. Slides are also available.

presentations.name: Turning Intelligence into Action with MITRE ATT&CK
presentations.description: This presentation from the FIRST CTI Symposium discusses how you can use ATT&CK for threat intelligence as well as biases to be aware of as you do that.

presentations.name: ATT&CK in Practice: A Primer to Improve Your Cyber-Defense
presentations.description: This presentation from RSA covers an overview of ATT&CK as well as key use cases and tools that can be used to convert it into practice.

presentations.name: ATT&CK by Numbers
presentations.description: This presentation from BSides NOVA explores a number of different ways to analyze the ATT&CK knowledge base and how organizations might perform similar analyses with their own data.

presentations.name: ATT&CK Your CTI: Lessons Learned from Four Years in the Trenches
presentations.description: This presentation from the SANS CTI Summit presents an overview of how two different organizations use ATT&CK to map adversary behavior and prioritize how you apply that intelligence to defenses. Slides are also available.

presentations.name: Advancing a Scientific Approach to Security Tool Evaluations with MITRE ATT&CK
presentations.description: his presentation from Shmoocon discusses the use case of evaluating security tools with ATT&CK. It provides an overview of the approach taken by the ATT&CK Evaluations initiative.

presentations.name: One technique, two techniques, red technique, blue technique
presentations.description: This presentation from BSides DC explores how you can apply ATT&CK to optimize and harmonize adversarial and defensive cyber operations.

presentations.name: ATT&CKing FIN7: The Value of Using Frameworks for Threat Intelligence
presentations.description: This presentation from the FireEye Cyber Defense Summit covers the use of ATT&CK as a framework for understanding FIN7 behaviors. Slides are also available.

presentations.name: ATT&CKing the Status Quo: Threat-Based Adversary Emulation with MITRE ATT&CK
presentations.description: This presentation from the SANS Threat Hunting Summit shows how you can use ATT&CK to apply threat intelligence to adversary emulation.

presentations.name: Stop, Drop, and Assess Your SOC
presentations.description: This presentation from the DEFCON Blue Team Village shows how ATT&CK can be used for Security Operations Center (SOC) assessments.

presentations.name: ATT&CKing the Status Quo: Improving Threat Intelligence and Cyber Defense with MITRE ATT&CK
presentations.description: This presentation from BSidesLV provides an overview of ATT&CK along with details on two use cases: threat intelligence and analytics. Slides are also available.

presentations.name: ATT&CKing with Threat Intelligence
presentations.description: This presentation from HOPE provides perspective on how to use threat intelligence for ATT&CK-based adversary emulation. Slides are also available.

presentations.name: Threat-based Purple Teaming with ATT&CK
presentations.description: This presentation from x33fcon discusses how purple teams can use ATT&CK as a common language for adversary emulation. Slides are also available.

presentations.name: Post-Exploit Threat Modeling with ATT&CK
presentations.description: This presentation from BSides Delaware outlines the key features of ATT&CK, describing the tactics, techniques, groups, and software that make up ATT&CK along with a discussion on how it can be used.
